basics.name: Tien Vo
basics.summary: Physics Ph.D. candidate at the University of Colorado at Boulder. I study signatures of particle acceleration due to turbulence and magnetic reconnection using data from the Magnetospheric Multiscale Mission.

specialized-trainings.name: PlasmaScience
specialized-trainings.summary: Studied various advanced topics in high-energy astrophysical plasmas, turbulence, magnetic reconnection, and shock acceleration mechanisms; learned advances in machine learning techniques for analyzing spacecraft data.

specialized-trainings.name: INnovative Training Enabled by a Research Software Engineering Community of Trainers (INTERSECT)
specialized-trainings.summary: Trained in Research Software Engineering (RSE), reproducible scientific computing, testing, CI/CD.

specialized-trainings.name: Argonne Training Program in Extreme-Scale Computing (ATPESC)
specialized-trainings.summary: Studied HPC topics such as hardware architectures, low-level programming models (SYCL, Kokkos, RAJA), parallel programming (MPI, OpenMP), I/O (darshan, MPI-IO, HDF5, NetCDF), visualization (VMD, Paraview, VisIt, Vapor), numerical algorithms (ARMReX, SuperLU/STRUMPACK, PETSc, HYPRE), and performance tools & debuggers (TotalView, Tau, HPCToolkits).

specialized-trainings.name: Texas Advanced Computing Center (TACC)
specialized-trainings.summary: Studied scientific HPC at Frontera and Stampede2 clusters: Slurm scheduling, visualization with structured & unstructured data, actor-based computation and Linux containers for automation of data acquisition and analysis.
